alert.note: Alert for Sandusky; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 3:56PM EST until March 06 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Maumee River At Waterville affecting Lucas and Wood Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Wayne and Holmes Counties. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maumee River...including Grand Rapids, Waterville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Portage River At Woodville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, water over State Route 105 in Sandusky County. Water near homes on Water, Bierley, and Bridge Streets in Pemberville. The river floods Trail Marker Park up to Erie Street in Woodville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EST Sunday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 4.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 08/21/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
